Specific Details: A proposed amendment to the Offences Against the Person Act was studied by our barrister and we wished to share this legal opinion with the department of justice. DPOs Lobbied: Jennifer Carroll MacNeill|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: A proposed amendment to the Offences Against the Person Act was studied by our barrister and we wished to share this legal opinion with the department of justice. We were initially concerned with the wording of the amendment and worried that it might not be specific enough to target the intended perpetrators designed by the act.
Intended Results: We wish for specific defences to be enacted into the act which have already been enacted or about to be enacted in Scotland, England, Wales and Northern Ireland. We wish also that our industry which is the only one licenced in these jurisdictions to be given greater recognition in law considering that we are in the service of the judicial system on a daily basis and assume great risk because of our work.

Specific Details: Briefing on Revolut's growth in Ireland (2m+ retail accounts and 150+ staff employed). Revolut’s investment in hi-tech fraud detection systems and anti-fraud processes; the need for urgent measures to stop fraud at source, as most originates from fake phone calls, fake texts and fake websites. Revolut credit - incl. personal loans and responsible Pay Later - and aim to support the green retrofit lending scheme. Revolut car insurance; long-term ambition to broaden lending and trading offerings
DPOs Lobbied: Michael McGrath|Minister|Department of Finance::Jennifer Carroll MacNeill|Minister of State|Department of Finance::Stephen Foley|Special Adviser|Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment::Kevin Barrett|Special Adviser|Department of Public Expenditure and Reform
Subject Matter: Briefing on Revolut's growth in Ireland (2m+ retail accounts and 150+ staff employed). Revolut’s investment in hi-tech fraud detection systems and anti-fraud processes; the need for urgent measures to stop fraud at source, as most originates from fake phone calls, fake texts and fake websites. Revolut credit - incl. personal loans and responsible Pay Later - and aim to support the green retrofit lending scheme. Revolut car insurance; long-term ambition to broaden lending and trading offerings
Intended Results: Support for Revolut’s continued growth and expansion in Ireland and for key measures to support fintechs, including heightened national/EU-level fraud responses; in particular, requiring telecoms and tech firms to stop at source the fake texts, calls and websites which enable fraud, and to be held liable for frauds enabled by fake texts, calls or websites.

Specific Details: RACO was invited to meet with Officials from the Fine Gael Party to discuss their pending election manifesto. At this meeting a number of current Defence policy issues were discussed. These included the implementation of the Working Time Directive in the DF, re-instatement of a supplementary pension for post-2013 entrants, implementation of the recommendations from the Commission on the DF and the provision of a full time Minister Defence.
DPOs Lobbied: Jennifer Carroll MacNeill|Minister|Department of Defence
Subject Matter: RACO was invited to meet with Officials from the Fine Gael Party to discuss their pending election manifesto. At this meeting a number of current Defence policy issues were discussed. These included the implementation of the Working Time Directive in the DF, re-instatement of a supplementary pension for post-2013 entrants, implementation of the recommendations from the Commission on the DF and the provision of a full time Minister Defence.
Intended Results:
The implementation of the WTD to the fullest possible extent into the DF.
Re-instatement of a Supplementary Pension for the post 2013 Public Service fast accrual group.

Specific Details: German-Irish Chamber of Commerce roundtable with Minister Jennifer Carroll MacNeill
DPOs Lobbied: Jennifer Carroll MacNeill|Minister of State|Department of Foreign Affairs
Subject Matter: German-Irish Chamber of Commerce roundtable with Minister Jennifer Carroll MacNeill
Intended Results: BASF Managing Director Thomas Birk and Daphne Vlastari, Head of Commnications and Government Relations, took part in a roundtable meeting with the Minister to discuss EU-wide industry efforts to raise awareness about issues of competitiveness. The main point of the discussion was cross-industry and stakeholder support for the Antwerp Declaration and how improvements can be made in policy, such as the upcoming Clean Industrial Deal, to support greater investment alongside commitment to net zero.
Lobbying Activities: The discussions took place during a roundtable meeting organised for members of the German-Irish Chamber of Commerce where Minister Jennifer Carroll MacNeill provided some opening remarks. BASF is a member of the chamber of commerce. The event took place on 17 September 2024. |Event / Reception|1
